intro: Cicerbita elongata, commonly known as the longleaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Its leaves are elongated and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are small and yellowish. Cicerbita elongata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
